data.shownotes: This show featured the live debut of Hypertension. The Reticent Raconteur and The Lord of Lightning were performed with Leah Senior providing the narration. I’m in Your Mind contained Cellophane teases. Cellophane contained Alter Me teases and quotes. Self-Immolate featured a Cavs drum solo which led into a brief metal vamp and ultimately returned to Self-Immolate. Rattlesnake contained Automation and Nuclear Fusion teases. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained a metal jam.

It was announced prior to the show that Stu was late to the stage because he had “diarrhea or something”. Stu then entered the stage costumed as “Disco Stu” and noted that it was his birthday show. After Hell, Stu teased "Stayin' Alive" (Bee Gees). Persistence was stopped partway through for a cake “being fucked by a sexy alien” to be presented to Stu, and for the crowd and band to sing “Happy Birthday to You” to Stu, after which Stu passed out the cake to the audience and several jokes were made about the cake's contents. Persistence was finished after the mid-song break. The River contained Wah Wah teases and an Ice V tease. Leah Senior was shouted out before Lava. At the end of the show, Stu was hit with silly string by the band while the audience sang to him again. KGLW.net Staff Notes: Fans of stage banter will want to listen to this show for humorous birthday comments throughout the show, and other amusing banter about being drunk and the Satanic nuns that often appear at their shows. Poster By Josh Freydkis

Evil Death Roll did not include the Invisible Face section and instead featured a Hypertension-esque jam (see below). The intro to Ambergris featured musical banter regarding a “big-ass beer”. Leah Senior was shouted out prior to Crumbling Castle. KGLW.net Staff Notes: There was a good deal of discussion about whether the jam in Evil Death Roll constituted a Hypertension tease or was merely suggesting a variation on Hypertension through Stu’s playing. We decided that this example did not qualify as a “tease”, “quote”, or full “jam.” Rather than expand our lexicon to include “motif” or “theme,” we opted to simply mention and qualify it in the setlist notes. Poster By Jordan Speer

Hot Wax was announced as a dedication to Joe Santarpia, one of the band's sound engineers. Hot Wax was played for the first time since 2022-04-28 (50 show gap). I’m Not in Your Mind contained Alter Me teases and quotes. Cellophane contained Am I in Heaven? teases and Hot Wax quotes. Ambergris was introduced as a song about “the most expensive ingredient in modern humanity.” Iron Lung featured an extended Red Hot Chili Peppers style intro while Lucas was using the restroom, followed by additional mid-song banter about Lucas. A New World through Altered Beast II featured Leah Senior providing the narration.

The band introduced the show by acknowledging how little they play hometown shows, citing Melbourne inner-city gentrification. Crumbling Castle was then introduced as “The Fourth Colour”, “Crumbling Castle”, and finally, “Gamma Knife”. The Fourth Colour featured a Cavs drum solo. The Grim Reaper was introduced as a song that Ambrose wrote about Stu, and featured an additional verse and quotes from Sadie Sorceress. Stu sang the third verse twice instead of the second verse in Ice V. Iron Lung was introduced as a “song about vaping”. Ambergris was introduced as a song about “the most expensive naturally occurring ingredient”. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained a Dragon jam.

This show was part of the 2022 Summer Haze Festival. Gaia featured a Cavs drum solo over the top of a metal vamp from the band. Ice V contained Hypertension teases. Stu threw water bottles into the crowd during Hot Water. Amusing banter before The Dripping Tap referenced the heat, sweating, church, God, Satan, weed, and vaping. The Dripping Tap subsequently contained Hypertension teases and quotes. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The recording for this show is incomplete (missing Hypertension). Despite the incomplete recording, KGLW.net staff supports the -> transition from Ice V -> Hypertension based on available audio evidence of the start of the transition near the end of Ice V. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

data.jamchart_notes: Top tier version containing a Hells Bells intro jam.
data.shownotes: Wah Wah contained The River intro. Hypertension contained a “Hells Bells” (AC/DC) intro. Work This Time contained a guitar solo. Predator X was listed on the written setlist between Planet B and Hell, but was not played except for a drum beat reminiscent of the intro. Gaia featured a drum solo by Cavs. Poster By Mr. Joe Johnson

This show featured the debut of Gila Monster. Honey contained Billabong Valley, Automation, and Rattlesnake teases. Iron Lung contained Hypertension teases. The River contained Wah Wah teases. Self-Immolate contained a “Fire” (Jimi Hendrix) quote and featured a drum solo by Cavs with “Machine Gun” (Jimi Hendrix) teases. After an instrumental intro to Am I in Heaven?, Stu, Joey, and Amby discuss recent dreams before continuing with the song. The song itself contained a “Stairway to Heaven” (Led Zeppelin) quote as well as “Stiff Upper Lip” (AC/DC) and Rattlesnake teases. Poster By Drew Millward

Gaia contained Motor Spirit teases. Her & I (Slow Jam 2) contained Iron Lung quotes and teases. This Thing was played for the first time since Feb. 21, 2020 (94 show gap) and contained The Dripping Tap quotes. Before Magenta Mountain, Stu announced that he was a “dickhead." Joey subsequently changed the lyrics of Magenta Mountain to “I don’t believe Stu”. Robot Stop contained Hot Water and Her & I (Slow Jam 2) teases. During Hot Water Stu took over drums & Cavs crowd surfed. Shanghai, Trapdoor and Evil Death Roll were on the printed setlist but were not played. Poster By Drew Millward

Oddlife was introduced as Cookie’s favorite song and contained Rattlesnake teases. Gaia contained Motor Spirit teases/quotes and featured a drum solo by Cavs. Following Gaia, Joey wished everyone a happy International Women’s Day. Iron Lung contained Hypertension teases. The Dripping Tap was introduced by Amby as being about both his neverending fountain of youth and how one day he will quit music and become a plumber. Poster By Lewy Jones
data.soundcheck: Kepler-22b, Work This Time, Nuclear Fusion

data.shownotes: Rattlesnake contained Automation teases and quotes. Ambrose quoted O.N.E. prior to Straws in the Wind. This Thing was introduced as a song about “being a piece of shit”. The jam out of Shanghai featured the first Grow Wings And Fly lyrics from Stu: “Let’s get real high and eat apple pie.” Evil Death Roll contained Shanghai, Mars for the Rich, and Hypertension teases. KGLW.Net Staff Notes: This may be the first time the voice of Han-Tyumi was run by Jason Galea offstage. Additional Han-Tyumi narration not previously played live may have been added to this version. Upon full review of all prior MoTU suites, additional notes may be added to describe first time or ongoing use of Han-Tyumi narration. Poster By Josh Freydkis 100 Standard/ 20 Foil / 30 AP

Robot Stop contained Hot Water teases and The Dripping Tap teases/quotes. Hot Water had lyrics changed to “time to party”. Persistence contained Sleepwalker teases. Hypertension contained Ice V teases/quotes. Sadie Sorceress was introduced as a song about Amby’s nana and contained a Crumbling Castle tease and an extra verse from The Grim Reaper. Shanghai was dedicated to orange juice and featured a Grow Wings and Fly 'Lets Get Real High' jam with dub keyboard elements highly reminiscent of The Scientist’s Butterfly 3001 Shanghai remix. Magenta Mountain had lyrics changed to “I don’t believe Stu”. Mars For the Rich was listed on the written setlist after Planet B but was not played. Gaia featured a drum solo by Cavs, during which Amby and Stu laid down on the stage to watch. Poster By Mr. Joe Johnson

The Grim Reaper contained an extra verse from Sadie Sorceress. Shanghai was stopped midway through, eventually resuming with a Grow Wings and Fly 'Lets Get Real High' jam. The Bitter Boogie contained Crumbling Castle teases. Prior to Lava, a pocket watch was passed up to the stage and Stu attempted to find the owner. Lava contained Hypertension teases. Wah Wah contained The River teases/quotes. It’s Got Old was played for the first time since April 13, 2022 (84 show gap) and was introduced as “a very old song that will most likely be fucking awesome and very reggae-ish” as well as containing a Blindness (The Fall) jam. Ice V had the intro and first verse performed without drums and contained Hypertension teases. Prior to The Dripping Tap, Amby introduced the song as the story of his kitchen sink and Joey shouted out one of the front-of-stage security staff who had been dancing to the music. The Dripping Tap contained Cellophane teases and closed with Amby quoting “So Long, Farewell” (The Sound of Music). Poster By Drew Millward

Gaia contained Motor Spirit teases/quotes and featured a drum solo by Cavs. Robot Stop contained Hot Water teases and The Dripping Tap teases/quotes. Hot Water contained The Dripping Tap teases and had lyrics changed to "time to party". The segue from Gamma Knife to Hypertension consisted of a full band outro of People-Vultures. Work This Time contained an “Incredible” (M Beat) quote. Work This Time contained a guitar solo. Shanghai featured a Grow Wings and Fly jam. Amby shouted out Tame Impala after Shanghai. The Grim Reaper featured an additional verse from Sadie Sorceress and contained Horology teases. The Dripping Tap contained Am I in Heaven? teases, Cellophane teases, Head On/Pill teases, and a jam reminiscent of Mycelium.

Wah Wah contained The River teases. Ambergris was introduced as a song about whale vomit. Hypertension contained Iron Lung quotes. Iron Lung contained Hypertension teases and Ice V teases. Before Shanghai, which was introduced as a song about how the band almost broke up over a hot pot, but it was alright because they all turned into butterflies afterward, Stu asked the crowd if they had even seen the band at various Sydney venues (Goodgod, World Bar), then Ambrose sung some of Lunch Meat. Shanghai featured a Grow Wings and Fly jam. The Grim Reaper featured an additional verse from Sadie Sorceress. Hell and Predator X were on the written setlist but were not played. Poster By Rowena Lloyd

This show featured the debut of Supercell. The Dripping Tap contained Hot Water teases and Hypertension teases. Robot Stop contained The Dripping Tap teases. Gamma Knife and People-Vultures contained Motor Spirit teases/quotes. Iron Lung contained Hypertension teases. Hypertension contained Witchcraft teases, Hot Water teases, and Robot Stop teases. KGLW.net Staff Notes: Special shout out to our very own @28rebounds for the recording located on Archive.org! Poster By Jason Galea 215 Standard / 80 Foil Print

Scheduled opening band Kamikaze Palm Tree’s set was cancelled due to an inclement weather warning. Rattlesnake contained Sleep Drifter teases/quotes, Honey teases and Boogieman Sam quotes, and had some of the “rattle, rattle, rattle” refrains changed to “boogie, boogie, boogie.”  Slow Jam 1 was introduced as "probably [Ambrose's] favorite song of ours" and contained Iron Lung and Her and I (Slow Jam 2) quotes.  Hell contained a Superbug outro.  Ambergris and The Great Chain of Being were on the printed setlist but were not played.

Poster By Jason Galea
2000 Standard / 500 Foil

This show featured the debut of Change. Plastic Boogie was played for the first time since June 5, 2022 (74 show gap) and contained a Black Dog (Led Zeppelin) outro. Prior to The Garden Goblin Joey teased the commercial theme for Bunnings Warehouse, an Australian home improvement store. The Garden Goblin was then introduced by Cookie as a song about the time his dog snuck into a Bunnings. The Dripping Tap contained Cellophane teases. Hot Wax was on the printed setlist but was not played. Hot Water and Hypertension were on the printed setlist after The Garden Goblin but were moved up to keep the band’s synth equipment out of the rain. This show was released through the Official Bootlegger program as part of Live in Chicago '23. KGLW.net staff note: There was much internal discussion as to a potential tease of the intro to Gondii in Change. The arrangement of instruments and structure of Change has been modified compared with the studio version. Though it resembles a tease of Gondii, we believe more live instances need to he heard to determine if this is intentional, or just an accentuation of the existing relationship between the songs. Poster By Jason Galea 460 Standard / 130 Foil

This was a three-hour marathon show and the first marathon show to be performed as a single set. The show opened with a video of Amby's father, Broderick Smith, introducing the band. Eyes Like the Sky through Evil Man was dedicated to Broderick Smith and featured Broderick’s narration from the Eyes Like the Sky album played over the PA while the band played, and photos of Broderick displayed on the large screen behind the band. Eyes Like the Sky, Year Of Our Lord, and The Raid were played for the first time since December 1, 2018 (192 show gap). Evil Man was played for the first time since February 18, 2016 (449 show gap). Prior to Gaia, Joey quoted “I Love L.A.” (Randy Newman). The Grim Reaper contained Torture Chamber quotes and “Intergalactic” (Beastie Boys) quotes. During the drum solo by Cavs following Astroturf the rest of the band left the stage, then returned and performed a metal vamp over the end of the solo. Shanghai featured the Grow Wings and Fly “let’s get real high” jam. Ambergris featured an extended intro during which Joey and Amby contemplated the nature of sexiness. The Dripping Tap was dedicated by Amby to Cavs’ dad and to his “first music teacher who said my voice sounds weird,” and contained Cellophane teases and Hot Water teases.

data.jamchart_notes: Sick segues on either end, this jam from the tour-opener is unleashed energy that crackles and sparks. Joey and Stu generate enough electricity to power this to the charts.
data.shownotes: Ice V Contained Am I In Heaven? teases.  Iron Lung contained Hypertension teases.

data.jamchart_notes: Oscar Karls of Viagra Boys on saxophone.
data.shownotes: Self-Immolate featured a drum solo by Cavs. This Thing was introduced as a song by Jimi Hendrix called "Hey James" and contained slightly alternate lyrics and The Dripping Tap teases & quotes. Hypertension was dedicated to Partiboi69. Magma was dedicated to John Butler. Hypertension and Magma featured Oscar Carls of Viagra Boys on saxophone. Wah Wah and Road Train were on the printed setlist but were not played.

Head On/Pill contained Witchcraft teases, Ice V teases and a Motor Spirit jam. Ice V contained Witchcraft teases. Hypertension contained teases of The Dripping Tap, Am I In Heaven? and People-Vultures. The Grim Reaper contained quotes of Torture Chamber, "Intergalactic” (Beastie Boys) and “Sabotage” (Beastie Boys). Poster by Bassant Ahmed

Iron Lung contained Hypertension teases.  Hypertension contained Evil Death Roll teases.  Ice V contained Presumptuous and Her and I teases.  Hot Water contained The Dripping Tap quotes and teases.  This Thing contained Hot Water quotes.

Poster By Max Löffler
data.venuename: Plaza Mayor de El Poble Espanyol

data.shownotes: Robot Stop contained a Hot Water jam with lyrics and Evil Death Roll teases. Hypertension contained Hot Water teases. This Thing contained a quote of “Walkin’ on the Sun” (Smash Mouth). Slow Jam 1 contained Iron Lung quotes. Poster by Michael Hacker
The Dripping Tap contained Hypertension teases. Hypertension contained Witchcraft teases. This Thing contained an “Incredible” (M Beat) quote and Hot Water teases. Gaia featured a drum solo by Cavs.

This Thing contained an “Incredible” (M Beat) quote. Hot Water contained an Am I In Heaven? tease and Converge teases. Wah Wah contained The River intro and teases, along with a Head On/Pill and Crumbling Castle tease. The Bitter Boogie contained a Work This Time jam and a Daily Blues jam. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained a Dragon jam.

Before Gaia, Joey teases Break Stuff (Limp Bizkit). Hypertension contained an Ice V intro, a Hot Water quote and a Work This Time Tease. Sea of Trees contained Hypertension, Robot Stop, and Hot Water teases. Robot Stop contained Hot Water and The Dripping Tap teases. Hot Water had its lyrics changed to “São Paulo”.

This show featured the debut of Flamethrower. Joey commented after, that they would do the last half of the song next time. Am I In Heaven? contained Sad Pilot, Flamethrower, and Cut Throat Boogie teases, a Witchcraft tease, and Iron Lung teases and quotes. Following Flamethrower, Joey shouted out opener Grace Cummings. This Thing contained La Grange (ZZ Top) teases and lyrics parodying the song. Iron Lung contained a Hypertension tease. Hypertension contained Witchcraft, Magma, and Ice V teases. Work This Time contained Ice V teases from Cavs. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained a metal jam. The written setlist had Doom City and Minimum Brain Size before Float Along - Fill Your Lungs but they were cut for time. Poster by Amy Jean; Edition of 100

This show featured the debut of Le Risque, which featured vocals from Cavs, making it his vocal debut. Grace Cummings unfortunately had to cancel at short notice, and was replaced with local Austrian band, Hypnotic Floor. Venusian 2 was introduced as a song about Venus. Slow Jam 1 contained Ice V, Sad Pilot, and Loyalty teases and a Chang'e (Extended) jam with lyrics. O.N.E. contained a Straws In The Wind intro. Billabong Valley was performed without Ambrose on guitar, but Stu on guitar for the second half and contained a Minimum Brain Size and Doom City tease. The banter between Billabong Valley and Le Risqué contained quotes and teases of My Generation by Limp Bizkit. Garden Goblin was introduced as being called Borat after Cookie’s vocals on the song. Iron Lung was dedicated to John Frusciante and contained Murder of The Universe, Witchcraft, and Hypertension teases. Hypertension contained a Robot Stop intro and teases of the new song and Evil Death Roll. Evil Death Roll did not contain the Invisible face segment and had Witchcraft, Converge, and Crumbling Castle teases. After the show, Ambrose sang “so long, farewell” from The sound of Music Poster by Amy Jean; Edition of 100

This show featured the debut of The Silver Cord. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained a Motor Spirit jam with lyrics. Mr. Beat contained a Hot Water tease, Motor Spirit quotes, and a Theia (Extended) jam with lyrics. Evil Death Roll contained a Theia tease and Witchcraft teases. Iron Lung contained Hot Water and Stairway to Heaven (Led Zeppelin) teases. Hot Water contained teases of “Third Stone From The Sun” (Jimi Hendrix), Gondii and Flamethrower. Hypertension contained Work This Time teases. Gaia featured a drum solo by Cavs and an extended full band jam following the drums. Inner Cell, Loyalty, Horology, and This Thing were on the physical setlist after The Silver Cord but were cut. Poster by Amy Jean; Edition of 150
data.soundcheck: The Silver Cord, Motor Spirit, Le Risque, Swan Song, Sad Pilot

data.shownotes: Gondii contained Extinction quotes and The Grim Reaper quotes and teases. A segue into The Grim Reaper out of Gondii was attempted but scrapped, and led to The Grim Reaper being skipped. Before Evil Death Roll, Stu teased Voodoo Child (Slight Return) and Little Wing (both by Jimi Hendrix). Joey yelled Free Palestine in Pleura. Poster by Amy Jean; Edition of 100

This show featured the debut of Flight b741. Extinction contained The Grim Reaper quotes. The Grim Reaper contained a Gondii tease and Torture Chamber quotes. Perihelion featured an audience member named Timmy on Joey's guitar, and was dedicated to his friend Joey who sadly passed in an accident earlier in the year. Magma was dedicated by Joey to John Bonham and contained a You Can Be Your Silhouette tease. After Daily Blues, Joey shouted out Lucas. Wah Wah contained a The River intro and jam. Hypertension contained Ice V and Work This Time teases. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained a Motor Spirit and Dragon tease. Perihelion was not on the printed setlist, but Sea of Trees was (which was skipped).

Poster by Jason Galea
Standard Edition of 600
Holographic Edition of 200

This show featured the debut of Set. Hypertension contained Hot Water teases. Following Raw Feel, Sympathy For The Devil (The Rolling Stones) was quoted. Hot Water contained a Robot Stop tease. Robot Stop contained a Hot Water jam with lyrics and Antarctica and Rats In The Sky quotes. Gamma Knife contained Motor Spirit teases. Set contained Extinction quotes and Panpysch teases.

Poster by Jason Galea
Standard Edition - 600
Foil Edition- 200

Hypertension contained Boogieman Sam teases and quotes and Ice V teases. Ice V contained Hypertension and Blindness (The Fall) teases. Antarctica contained an outro jam without drums for Cavs to take a piss break. Before Gaia, Stu joked about how Supercell sounds like "soup for sale". Gaia contained a drum solo during which fans gave shirts to Stu. Before Mars For the Rich Stu put a hat (that he had earlier picked up from the stage) on backwards, jokingly compared himself to Lleyton Hewitt (an Australian former tennis player who was known for wearing hats backwards), and imitated his trademark fist pump. Swan Song (#2) contained Dragon quotes. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained a Dragon jam with lyrics.

Poster by Jason Galea
Standard Edition - 600
Foil Edition - 200

Audience member Joe did the vocal intro to Nuclear Fusion. Cellophane contained I'm In Your Mind, Am I In Heaven?, and Lord of Lightning teases. Mystery Jack was last played 2022-05-31. (138 show gap) Hypertension contained Witchcraft and Hot Water teases. Ambrose did a short breakdance after his verse of Le Risque and said Raygun taught him everything he knows. The Grim Reaper contained Telescope (Ambrose Kenny-Smith & GUM), Torture Chamber, Body Movin' and Intergalactic (Beastie Boys) quotes. Magenta Mountain was attempted but only a jam was played (Titled We're Doin' It Together on the Official Bootleg) because Joey's synth wasn't working. This Thing contained a The Land Before Timeland tease. The intro to Am I In Heaven? (which was not on the printed setlist) contained Lava and The Dripping Tap teases and the song itself contained a This Thing tease and a Hypertension jam with lyrics. 

Poster By Job van Rijen
Standard: 600
Gold Foil: 200

Amby joined opener Geese on 3D Country. Cellophane featured Ambrose on sax. Self-Immolate featured a drum solo with Riff Raff (AC/DC) teases from Stu ending in a Moby Dick (Led Zeppelin) tease. Motor Spirit was dedicated to everyone on the highway. Gilgamesh contained Gila Monster quotes. Set contained Gilgamesh quotes. Nuclear Fusion featured Hunter, an audience member, on the intro. Ataraxia, which was last played 2023-08-16 (54 show gap), had its lyrics changed to "I am a father now”. Field of Vision was dedicated to Jess Lewis (the band's tour manager who is mention in the song). Raw Feel contained a Sympathy For The Devil (The Rolling Stones) quote. Lava was last played 2023-06-03 (71 show gap) and did not contain the intro. Before Antarctica, Joey shouted out opener Geese and Stu was handed a fox mask, which he put on followed by a full band tease of Foxey Lady (Jimi Hendrix). Joey quoted Billy Madison as the song started “Extra Sloppy for ya.”

Poster by Amy Jean

An audience member (Sheri) did the vocal intro to Nuclear Fusion. After the song, the crowd chanted Sheri’s name. Joey said "Free Palestine" in Pleura. During Straws In The Wind, Ambrose roamed the venue, eventually making it to the soundboard, where he played with the onstage visuals and exchanged banter with Stu and Joey. Before Mars For The Rich the band teased Moby Dick (Led Zeppelin). Following Raw Feel, Cavs teased Hey Pachuco (Royal Crown Revue) from The Mask. Garden Goblin was introduced as a dog based song Poster by Jason Galea

data.jamchart_notes: A fiery rendition with multiple teases
data.shownotes: This show featured the debut of Intrasport, which featured Lucas on Joey's microtonal guitar and Joey on tambourine. Following Billabong Valley Joey shouted out King Stingray and their relationship to Yothu Yindi and Warumpi Band. Hypertension contained teases of Whole Lotta Rosie (AC/DC), La Grange (ZZ Top) and Ice V. Stu teased La Grange again before Antarctica. Joey shouted out Cookie's new Pipe-Eye album in the intro to Ambergris. A segue from Sad Pilot into Rats In the Sky was completed; immediately following the segue the show was stopped for approximately 4 minutes to help a fan who passed out and Rats was then restarted from the beginning. Gaia featured a drum solo by Cavs.

Plastic Boogie contained Hypertension, The Land Before Timeland, The Dripping Tap, and This Thing teases. Straws In The Wind contained I’m Bored (Iggy Pop), Smoke & Mirrors, and Phantom Island quotes. Before Intrasport, the band introduced the synth table with its new nickname "Nathan". Set contained Ice V and Work This Time teases. Extinction contained the Flamethrower quotes from the extended mix. Irong Lung contained Hypertension teases. Hypertension contained a Crumbling Castle tease and a The Dripping Tap tease. Hog Calling Contest was teased before Antarctica, which contained Hot Water teases. Hog Calling Contest and Flight b741 featured Joey on acoustic guitar. The River contained Wah Wah teases and Row, Row, Row Your Boat (traditional) quotes.  Le Risque was on the written setlist after The River but was not played.

Hypertension contained La Grange (ZZ Top) teases. Joey introduced Cavs as "Michelle Caviar" before Le Risque.  Evil Death Roll contained Mirage City and Hypertension teases. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained a Dragon jam with lyrics.

Iron Lung contained a Hypertension intro and teases. Hypertension contained Am I In Heaven? and Hot Water teases, Boogieman Sam teases, The River teases and Boogieman Sam quotes. Fans Silvia and David provided the vocal intro on Nuclear Fusion. Evil Death Roll was introduced as a song about crocodiles and contained Interior People and Hypertension teases. Digital Black was introduced as a song about the near future. Le Risque contained teases of La Grange (ZZ Top) and The Bitter Boogie. Welcome To An Altered Future was on the printed setlist but not played.

This show featured the debuts of Jailbreak (AC/DC) and the synth outro of Flamethrower. Ambrose sung along to the walkout music, which was Party All the Time (Eddie Murphy). Antarctica contained Hot Water and Forty Six and 2 (Tool) teases. Before Hypertension, the band talked about Stu's new guitar, mentioning Jimi Hendrix and Dimebag Darrell, and joking that they wanted to play Little Wing on the table, but Cavs said no because he wanted to play Foxy Lady and Cookie wanted to play She's So Fine. Boogieman Sam was teased before Ice V, which contained Blindness (The Fall) teases. Ambrose quoted “Good day, good evening, and good night!” from The Truman Show before Rats In The Sky. Jailbreak was impromptu/not on the written setlist, unfinished, and contained a Rats In the Sky outro. The Fourth Colour was on the printed setlist after Crumbling Castle but was not played.
data.soundcheck: Motor Spirit, Crumbling Castle > The Fourth Colour

data.shownotes: Oddlife was introduced as Cookie's favorite song. Sense was performed in it's synth arrangement and contained The Grim Reaper teases. The Grim Reaper contained Intergalactic, Sabotage, and (You Gotta) Fight for Your Right (To Party!) (all by the Beastie Boys) quotes, and at the end of the song Ambrose thanked the Beastie Boys. Wah Wah contained a The River intro with Crumbling Castle teases and the song itself contained The River quotes, Crumbling Castle teases and Extinction teases and quotes. Let Me Mend The Past, which contained an It Ain't Me, Babe (Bob Dylan) quote, was dedicated to Amby's hangover anxieties. Hypertension contained Extinction teases and quotes. Alter Me (unnumbered) was on the setlist before Altered Beast IV but was not played.

This show was played with The Sydney Symphony Orchestra conducted by Chad Kelly.  Intermission Jam contained Hypertension teases.  The River contained teases of Thunderstruck (AC/DC) and Her and I.  Dragon was introduced as a song about capitalism.  Before Iron Lung Joey said Free Palestine.

Altered Beast I contained an Alter Me intro.  Alter Me II was played for the first time since 2022-10-31 (177 shows) and contained Hypertension quotes and teases and Forty Six & 2 (Tool) teases. Altered Beast IV contained Hypertension teases.  Hypertension contained Riff Raff (AC/DC), Forty Six & 2 (Tool) and Sad Pilot teases. Muddy Water and The Bitter Boogie were performed as a mashup with parts of each song interspersed throughout the other.  Sad Pilot contained teases of The Bitter Boogie and Machine Gun (Jimi Hendrix).  The band's guitar tech Gaspard, introduced as Gary, played drums on Le Risque while Cavs performed his verse from the front of the stage and stayed on drums for the rest of the song.  Motor Spirit was introduced as a song about cars.  Ambrose quoted The Next Episode (Dr. Dre & Snoop Dogg) in Motor Spirit after the band took shots following Gila Monster. At the end of the show the band shouted out opener Barkaa and Joey said "from the river to the sea, free Palestine."  The written setlist had Raw Feel listed as Raw Phil, Muddy Water and The Bitter Boogie listed as Muddy Boogie // Bitter Water, Sad Pilot listed as Rad Pilot and Hot Wax listed as Hot Phacts.
